mapper.sql: select id, name, description, create_by, create_time, update_by, update_time from exam_question_bank
mapper.select: SELECT a.id,b."name" FROM exam_question_bank_questions as a LEFT JOIN exam_question_bank as b on a.question_bank_id = b.id where a.examination_question_id = #{questionId}

SELECT bank.id, bank.name, bank.description, ( SELECT count(*) FROM exam_question_bank_questions AS b JOIN exam_questions AS q ON q.id = b.examination_question_id WHERE b.question_bank_id = bank.id AND q.type = 'select' ) AS selectCount, ( SELECT count(*) FROM exam_question_bank_questions AS b JOIN exam_questions AS q ON q.id = b.examination_question_id WHERE b.question_bank_id = bank.id AND q.type = 'selects' ) AS selectsCount, ( SELECT count(*) FROM exam_question_bank_questions AS b JOIN exam_questions AS q ON q.id = b.examination_question_id WHERE b.question_bank_id = bank.id AND q.type = 'verdict' ) AS verdictCount, ( SELECT count(*) FROM exam_question_bank_questions AS b JOIN exam_questions AS q ON q.id = b.examination_question_id WHERE b.question_bank_id = bank.id AND q.type = 'answer' ) AS answerCount FROM exam_question_bank AS bank JOIN exam_question_bank_role role ON bank.id = role.question_bank_id
and role.role_id in
#{roleId}
and name like concat('%', #{name}, '%')
